items.headline: AI Optimism and Tariff Jitters Drive Mixed Sentiment
items.summary: Wall Street extended gains for a second consecutive session, fueled by Nvidia's upbeat revenue forecast which revived confidence in the AI trade. The Nasdaq 100 led the rebound, with the S&P 500 and Dow Jones erasing earlier tariff-driven losses. While momentum appears positive in the near term, thinning futures volume and major psychological resistance levels suggest that a straightforward break to new highs may not be imminent. Market sentiment remains cautious, especially following Salesforce's softer guidance and ongoing geopolitical developments concerning tariffs. U.S. stock futures showed a slight decline in early trading, indicating a potentially softer open.

items.statContext: +0.81% (Feb 25, 2026). Futures were down 0.15% in early trading.
+1.3% (Feb 25, 2026). Futures were down 0.35% in early trading.
+0.6% (Feb 25, 2026). Futures were down 0.20% in early trading.

items.headline: Nvidia's Earnings Beat Drives Continued AI Focus
items.summary: Nvidia ($NVDA) reported better-than-expected Q4 2026 earnings and revenue after market close on February 25. The stock initially jumped 3.5% after hours, though it later faded below $200 and remained relatively flat in extended trading despite the strong results, as investors assessed the broader implications for the tech sector.

items.headline: Tata Motors Leads Indian Market Gains
Salesforce Falls on Disappointing Outlook
items.summary: Salesforce ($CRM) shares fell approximately 5% after the company issued a softer-than-expected Fiscal 2027 revenue guidance.

items.headline: United Spirits Declines in Indian Trading
Technology and AI Sectors Remain in Focus
items.summary: Technology stocks, particularly those linked to Artificial Intelligence, continue to drive market movements. While Nvidia's strong earnings fueled optimism, some software companies have experienced declines due to concerns about AI disruption. Communication Services and Healthcare also showed strength.

items.headline: Jobless Claims and PPI Data Awaited
items.summary: Investors are looking ahead to the release of weekly jobless claims data today and the January Producer Price Index (PPI) report on Friday, which could provide further insights into the economic landscape. The Federal Trade Commission is also hosting a workshop today on measuring injuries and benefits in the data-driven economy.

items.headline: Key Earnings Reports Continue
items.summary: Today brings a fresh batch of earnings reports from major companies. Royal Bank of Canada ($RY), TD Bank ($TD), Canadian Imperial Bank of Commerce ($CM), Warner Bros. Discovery ($WBD), Sempra ($SRE), and Vistra ($VST) are among those reporting prior to market open. After hours, Dell Technologies ($DELL) and Intuit ($INTU) are scheduled to release their results, keeping the AI infrastructure story alive. Northland Power Inc. ($NPI), WSP Global Inc., KION Group, and WPP plc also released their latest financial results today.

items.headline: Global Tariff Policies Resurface as Market Influence
items.summary: Geopolitical tensions, particularly concerning global tariff policies, are influencing market sentiment. President Trump recently signed an executive order raising global tariffs to 15% from 10%, adding a layer of caution for investors.
